meanings.definition: To lose possession of; to let go of.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally leese my grip on the balloon.
meanings.sent2: She leese her favorite toy at the park.
meanings.sent3: After a big sneeze, he leese control of his pencil.
meanings.sent4: The magician leese the bird from his hat.
meanings.sent5: The slippery soap leese from my hand and falls to the floor.

meanings.definition: A contract granting the use of property for a specified period of time in exchange for rent.
meanings.sent1: The leese for the apartment was signed last week.
meanings.sent2: He carefully reviewed the leese before moving in.
meanings.sent3: The leese agreement included a clause about pet ownership.
meanings.sent4: She studied the leese document late into the night.
meanings.sent5: The leese outlined the responsibilities of both the landlord and the tenant.

meanings.sent1: The firefighter leese water onto the burning building.
meanings.sent2: He leese a deep sigh of relief after the exam.
meanings.sent3: The pressure valve leese steam to prevent an explosion.
meanings.sent4: She leese her emotions through her artwork.
meanings.sent5: The dam leese a torrent of water downstream during the storm.
